intro: Sonchus tataricus, commonly known as Siberian sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Asia and Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and a basal rosette of leaves. Its yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, followed by the production of small, oval seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
